title: Horbury Canal Walk Route

images.title: Stephen Dawson / Broad Cut Low Lock
images.caption: Broad Cut Low Lock

images.title: Oxana Maher / Fishing on the Horbury cut, Calder & Hebble Navigation
images.caption: Fishing on the Horbury cut, Calder & Hebble Navigation A tranquil and pleasant stretch of the Horbury cut. A good place to see swans too. The footbridge, carrying Balk Lane, actually runs along the border of two adjacent grid squares, ending in the square to the west.

images.title: Oxana Maher / Weir on the river
images.caption: Weir on the river just before it joins the Calder & Hebble Navigation canal

images.title: Oxana Maher / Bridges over the Horbury Cut, Calder & Hebble Navigation
images.caption: Bridges over the Horbury Cut, Calder and Hebble Navigation

images.title: Oxana Maher / Recreation field, Calder & Hebble canal
images.caption: Recreation field, Calder & Hebble canal. Large recreation area on the northern side of the canal. Popular with model car racing enthusiasts.

images.title: Thornes Flood Lock from river by Mike Todd, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Thornes Flood Lock from river

images.title: At Pugneys Country Park, Wakefield by Neil Theasby, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: At Pugneys Country Park, Wakefield

description: This village near Wakefield has some pleasant waterside walks along the canal and the River Calder. This walk from the village takes you east along the Calder and Hebble Navigation canal to visit Calder Grove and Pugneys Country Park. Here you can enjoy some lovely footpaths around the picturesque lakes and wildlife rich nature reserve. Please scroll down for the full list of walks near and around Horbury. The detailed maps below also show a range of footpaths, bridleways and cycle paths in the area.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Navigation Inn is splendidly positioned on an island between the River Calder & Calder & Hebble Navigation. You can sit outside and watch the boats go by on the waterways. It's also a short walk from Calder Vale on the other bank of the river via an interesting tubular footbridge. The pub can be found at Broad Cut Road, Calder Grove, WF4 3DS. The inn is dog friendly.

display_address: Bingley Arms, 221, Bridge Road, Sitlington, Horbury Bridge, Wakefield, West Yorkshire, England, WF4 5QA, United Kingdom
